com.aloqa.trax.client.positiontrack
Interface PositionProvider

All Superinterfaces:
PositionSource, java.lang.Runnable
public interface PositionProvider
extends java.lang.Runnable, PositionSource

This interface provides an abstraction layer for different PositionProviders like GPS Reciever, RFID Scanner, etc. A PositionProvider is run in its own thread, which is why it implements the Runnable interface.

Method Detail

die

void die()
Kills this PositionProvider. After this invocation, this PositionProvider may no longer deliver any positions to the associated PositionListener. Used system ressources can be cleaned up.

setPositionListener

void setPositionListener(PositionListener pl)
Sets the PositionListener this PositionProvider provides positions to on a regular basis.

Parameters:
pl - The PositionListener this PositionProvider provides positions to on a regular basis.

sleep

void sleep(int maxDistance,
           int maxTime)
Recommends this PositionProvider that it can stop generating position fixes for a given maximum distance and a maximum time. The stop is optional and has the aim to save energy. After either one of the maximum time or the maximum distance has elapsed with respect to the last generated position fix, new positions must again be generated by this PositionProvider.

Parameters:
maxDistance - The maximum distance to sleep in meters.
maxTime - The maximum time to sleep in milliseconds.

wakeup

void wakeup()
Wakes up this PositionProvider from a previous call to sleep(int, int) and tells this PositionProvider to immediately start generating positions again (Of course only, if this PositionProvider is enabled, cp PositionSource.setEnabled(boolean)).
